newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korean won closes higher, upside limited.
newsitem.headline: S.Korean won closes higher, upside limited.

text.p: The won closed higher on Monday, reflecting abundant dollar positions in the market, but dealers said the strength of the local currency was limited on fears of central bank's interventions.
"The market was lethargic, trapped in a tight range," said a foreign bank dealer. "Nobody wants to risk the dollar's upside with ample dollars in the market."
Dealers said the won's rise was also limited as many hoped the central bank would step in to give a boost in the market.
The won ended at 888.90, compared with Friday's close of 889.30.
After opening at 889.00, the won fell to the day's low of 889.10 on short-covering and rose to a high of 888.60 on abundant dollars.
Dealers said dollar's strength against the yen in Tokyo had no direct impact in the won/dollar market.
"With no specific market impetus, the dollar will fall slightly further and move around the 888 level," the foreign bank dealer said.
Tuesday's mid-rate was expected to be fixed at 888.80 against 889.30 today.
